DIALOGUE BEFORE: Austin: Really? Gee, thanks mister.
RESPONSE TEXT: I was worried to death about you Austin.
What got into your fool head, going into a place like that?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Austin: Nothing exciting ever happens here.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DrForsythe: Let's hope this works.
RESPONSE TEXT: I heard you had returned.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DrForsythe: It shouldn't be long.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DrForsythe: I've had it for years and never really had a use for it.
RESPONSE TEXT: She's not the only one. The whole vault is thankful.
I'd like to give you a room here in the vault. A place you can call your own.
It's in the main hall, on the left as you get off the elevator.
Once again, thank you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Austin: Can I go see gran? How about something to eat? I'm starving.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DrForsythe: Our visitor from the Commonwealth saved your life.
RESPONSE TEXT: Thank god.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Austin: Really? Gee, thanks mister.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: NPCFGwenMcNamara: I hope you enjoy your accommodations.
RESPONSE TEXT: I wanted to say thank you again for what you did for Austin.
You've opened a lot of eyes around here, including my own.
I had no idea of the dangers Vault-Tec had hidden away so close to home.
I can't believe so many died just behind our walls.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Overseer: You'll always be welcome here, and I hope you make a habit of visiting.
SCRIPT NOTES: Slight shock, reflecting on what must have happened. / Neutral

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: No arguments here.
RESPONSE TEXT: I hate to think of what they had planned for us.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worriedly thinking of what could have happened / Concerned

RESPONSE TEXT: But on the good side, you made a real impression on our 'anti-Commonwealth' people.
They're realizing outsiders really can be trusted, and do more good than just providing resources.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Overseer: You'll always be welcome here, and I hope you make a habit of visiting.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'll go see him immediately.
RESPONSE TEXT: Thank you. Dr. Forsythe should be in the medical center.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You're on your own.
RESPONSE TEXT: This is a real emergency. If you won't help us, perhaps you should reconsider ever coming back to 81.
SCRIPT NOTES: A bit angry, losing patience. / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: Should you change your mind, Dr. Forsythe is in the medical center. I strongly suggest you go see him.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I might have the time.
RESPONSE TEXT: I pray you do for Austin's sake. Dr. Forsythe is in the medical center. Please speak with him as soon as you can.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Why me? You have security.
RESPONSE TEXT: Our security knows how to point and shoot, but when it comes to real combat, they have no experience.
SCRIPT NOTES: Matter of fact, but urgent. / Concerned

RESPONSE TEXT: Maybe we could handle Raiders or Gunners, but these creatures? We wouldn't know where to begin.
SCRIPT NOTES: Matter of fact but urgent. / Concerned

RESPONSE TEXT: Please, we need your help.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'll go see him immediately.
SCRIPT NOTES: Really needs the player's help for a situation she can't handle. / Concerned

DIALOGUE BEFORE: NPCFGwenMcNamara: You. You're back. I'm not sure if you've spoken to Dr. Forsythe yet, but if you haven't, we really need your help.
RESPONSE TEXT: One of the children here is very ill. He's been bitten by some... creature, and we need someone with good combat training to help him.
Someone who knows the creatures of the Commonwealth.
I'd like for you to please speak to Dr. Forsythe. He can give you the details.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'll go see him immediately.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm sorry, I really am, but I have a lot of people out there to take care of. People that count on me.
RESPONSE TEXT: I suppose I can understand that to a degree. I'm sorry, too. I realize there's a lot about your life that I don't know.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Overseer: Now, I have a lot of work ahead of me. I trust you can see yourself out.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: A full life trapped in this Vault? That's no life. I saved him.
RESPONSE TEXT: You barely knew Austin. If he had lived to see adulthood, I've no doubt he would have done great things.
Whether it be here in 81 or outside in the Commonwealth.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Overseer: Now, I have a lot of work ahead of me. I trust you can see yourself out.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Consider it an act of self-preservation. What I did, it's only human.
RESPONSE TEXT: I realize that, and believe me, I know many would have done the same.
I just hoped you would be better.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Overseer: Now, I have a lot of work ahead of me. I trust you can see yourself out.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Can't we move past this?
RESPONSE TEXT: No. If you're gonna continue doing business here in Vault 81, I demand an explanation.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm sorry, I really am, but I have a lot of people out there to take care of. People that count on me.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: NPCFGwenMcNamara: I've seen a lot of selfish acts in my day, but yours will be one to remember.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm sorry, I really am, but I have a lot of people out there to take care of. People that count on me.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I suppose I can understand that to a degree. I'm sorry, too. I realize there's a lot about your life that I don't know.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Whatever Vault-Tec had planned, it failed, and took their entire staff out with it.
RESPONSE TEXT: No arguments here.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Overseer: You'll always be welcome here, and I hope you make a habit of visiting.

RESPONSE TEXT: From what I've seen, I believe you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Overseer: You'll always be welcome here, and I hope you make a habit of visiting.

RESPONSE TEXT: I don't doubt that one bit.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Overseer: You'll always be welcome here, and I hope you make a habit of visiting.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried about what could have happened. / Worried

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What do you know about Vault-Tec?
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm afraid not much. I've spent my entire life being thankful for the Vault, for the walls that protected us over two centuries.
But not once have I had contact with them.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Overseer: You'll always be welcome here, and I hope you make a habit of visiting.

RESPONSE TEXT: I hope you enjoy your accommodations.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Overseer: I wanted to say thank you again for what you did for Austin.

RESPONSE TEXT: You. You're back. I'm not sure if you've spoken to Dr. Forsythe yet, but if you haven't, we really need your help.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Overseer: One of the children here is very ill. He's been bitten by some... creature, and we need someone with good combat training to help him.

RESPONSE TEXT: Hi, Erin.
Hope you're staying out of trouble, Austin.

RESPONSE TEXT: Shouldn't you be working, Holt?
Before you ask, I like my hair just the way it is, Horatio.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly rejection, like a back and forth they've had every day for a long time. / Amused

RESPONSE TEXT: Maria, when you get a chance, send up a slice of that pie.
I like how clean the diner looks, Mark.
Keep up the good work, Katy.
Don't you have some real work you need to do?
Keep an eye on your brother, Tina. I don't like how he looks lately.
I'm sorry about Bobby. I wish we could have helped him.
Hello, Rachel.
Dr. Forsythe.
Take time to look around. You'll have the full run of the place.
Some of our residents aren't as thrilled about outsiders as most, so please, don't think they speak for all of us.
Feel free to make the most of the services we offer while you're here.
Have you been down to medical to see Dr. Forsythe, yet? He told me he's very interested in meeting you.
If you haven't already, you should stop by the classroom. Katy would love to have you speak to her students.
Still got that Power Armor on? Honestly, there's no need for it here.
I'm very worried about Austin. I hope you're able to help us.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried about a very sick child. / Worried

RESPONSE TEXT: It's frustrating that all our medical knowledge hasn't been enough to help Austin.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried about a very sick child. / Worried

RESPONSE TEXT: Dr. Forsythe is doing all he can, but we're not sure it's going to be enough.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried about a very sick child. / Worried

RESPONSE TEXT: Kids and their curiosity. Damn that Bobby DeLuca. I can't believe this happened.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried about a very sick child. / Worried

RESPONSE TEXT: Poor Priscilla. She's worried sick. She's barely eaten or slept since it happened.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried about a very sick child and his guardian. / Worried

RESPONSE TEXT: Damn Vault-Tec. What the hell were they thinking?
This will give the anti-Commonwealth people something to bitch about for years.
I need to check on Priscilla again. Make sure she's at least eating and getting some rest.
I hope Calvin gets someone to seal up that hole.
SCRIPT NOTES: Matter of fact with some sadness / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Jesus, this year can't get any worse.
You've really made my life hard, outsider.
The people here will never forget what you did for Austin.
Austin's making a quick recovery thanks to you. It's good to see him back to normal.
Your presence here has really made a difference. You've opened a lot of minds to the idea of welcoming in the Commonwealth.
Dr. Penske has been keeping an extra close eye on Austin since he recovered. I think she's going to drive him crazy.
It's crazy to think we never knew that portion of the Vault existed all this time.
I haven't got all day. I've got a Vault to run.
Can we hurry this along? I'm a busy woman.
Well?

Did you come from one of the Vaults? Is it still operational?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: GwenMcNamara: Gwen McNamara. Overseer. Welcome to Vault 81.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: They had us cryogenically frozen in these pods. But something malfunctioned.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: They had us cryogenically frozen in these pods. But something malfunctioned.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So Vault 81 is still stable? Have you guys ever had anything go wrong?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Oh my God. All those lives lost due to some malfunction? That's unacceptable.
